title: Catholic Network Tours Country To Improve Voter Turnout
teaser: Nuns on the Bus are an organization that travels around the country to advocate for social justice and to increase voter turnout.
contentencoded:
North Carolina is in the midst of a very closely watched Senate race that could determine which party controls the upper chamber in Washington.

Democratic Senator Kay Hagan is facing off against Republican State House Speaker Thom Tillis. And it’s a dead heat in the polls. As result, much of the focus is on voter turnout.

That was the subject of a potluck Here & Now’s Jeremy Hobson attended yesterday at the Pullen Memorial Baptist Church in Raleigh, where special guests, Nuns on the Bus are visiting.

  • Here & Now: Politics At One Rural Church In North Carolina
